intro: Crotalaria sapinii subsp. kasaiensis, commonly known as the Kasai crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. It has a short flowering period, usually during the rainy season, and produces small, round pods containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its genus.
